channel.title: Elucidator Model (Kirito's Sword)
channel.description:
A few people asked me to model this... only my 2nd model ive actually tried working on.
I got lazy on the hilt lol.
http://imgur.com/itEywjw http://imgur.com/Gmci8GX http://imgur.com/10FN15F http://imgur.com/t9Ss50R http://imgur.com/izI1kkM
If you have been living under a rock and don't know what this sword is (anyone got that joke? lol?) :P http://imgur.com/eEQQoBy

item.title: Elucidator Model (Kirito's Sword)
item.dc:creator: @furyking50 furyking50
item.description:
@furyking50 wrote:

[quote=“amy_webb, post:2, topic:553349”]Pretty good for a 2nd model, but there are a few things you can do to make it look a little smoother.

The blade is very straight so when modelling it, try use as little poly as possible. When you put it ingame it will stop it warping and looking wavy.

An example of wireframe:
[spoiler][/spoiler]

Also, its ok to model the blade and hilt separate then apply the cross after. It might not be one model but it can be neater, if there is no way around it. I also noticed the model was spaced, as thought you didn’t join the points after mirroring the model. There is an easy way of doing this boring part, ive made a quick example for you.

[spoiler]

[/spoiler]

Still, good job and hope to see more models from you. :)[/quote]

Thanks alot… about to join it!

Read full topic

item.title: Elucidator Model (Kirito's Sword)
item.dc:creator: @amy_webb1 amy_webb
item.description:
@amy_webb1 wrote:

Pretty good for a 2nd model, but there are a few things you can do to make it look a little smoother.

The blade is very straight so when modelling it, try use as little poly as possible. When you put it ingame it will stop it warping and looking wavy.

An example of wireframe:
[spoiler][/spoiler]

Also, its ok to model the blade and hilt separate then apply the cross after. It might not be one model but it can be neater, if there is no way around it. I also noticed the model was spaced, as thought you didn’t join the points after mirroring the model. There is an easy way of doing this boring part, ive made a quick example for you.

[spoiler]

[/spoiler]

Still, good job and hope to see more models from you.

Read full topic
